contentItemData.label: Documentation Index
contentItemData.description: Provides an overview and hyperlinks to all packaged documentation.

contentItemData.label: AN961: Bringing Up Custom Devices for the Mighty Gecko and Flex Gecko Families
contentItemData.description: SL Thread: Describes how to initialize a piece of custom hardware (a 'device') based on the Mighty Gecko and Flex Gecko families so that it interfaces correctly with a network stack. The same procedures can be used to restore devices whose settings have been corrupted or erased.

contentItemData.label: tftp-bootloader-client-app Reference
contentItemData.description: SL Thread: Describes using the tftp-bootloader-client-app bootloading application.

contentItemData.label: UG103-04: Fundamentals - HAL
contentItemData.description: SL Thread: Silicon Labs HAL (Hardware Abstraction Layer) is program code between a system's hardware and its software that provides a consistent interface for applications that can run on several different hardware platforms. The HAL is designed for developers using EmberZNet PRO, EmberZNet RF4CE, and Silicon Labs Thread on the Wireless Gecko (EFR32) portfolio and the EM3x-Based MCU family of products.

contentItemData.label: Silicon Labs Thread API Reference Guide
contentItemData.description: SL Thread: Contains a comprehensive list of APIs used to interface to the Thread network. These APIs concern network management, device and stack management (including management of stack tables, event scheduling, message buffers and security), messaging, fragmentation, serial communication, token access, peripheral access, bootload utilities and others.

contentItemData.label: AN703: Using the Simulated EEPROM for the EM35x and Mighty Gecko Family SoC Platforms
contentItemData.description: SL Thread: Describes how to use the simulated EEPROM in Silicon Labs' EM35x and Mighty Gecko (EFR32MG) platforms, gives an overview of the internal design, and discusses design considerations. You should already be familiar with the token system in the HAL. For more information on HAL and the token system, see the online HAL API documentation.

contentItemData.label: Silicon Labs Thread Framework README
contentItemData.description: SL Thread: Describes the Silicon Labs Thread framework plugins and libraries, roughly divided into three categories: HAL, stack, and application.

contentItemData.label: AN1031: Thread Large Network Scalability
contentItemData.description: SL Thread: Details methods and results for Thread large network scalability and performance testing. This testing focuses on the scalability of these networks while carrying out unicast and multicast traffic typical of a large commercial installation. The methodology for performing the benchmarking tests is defined to allow others to run the same tests. These results are intended to provide guidance on design practices and principles as well as expected field performance results.

contentItemData.label: AN1017: ZigBee and Thread Coexistence with WiFi
contentItemData.description: SL Thread: Describes the impact of Wi-Fi on ZigBee and Thread, and methods to improve coexistence. First, methods to improve coexistence without direct interaction between ZigBee/Thread and Wi-Fi radios are described (for both EM35x/EM358x and EFR32MG). Second, Silicon Labs's Packet Traffic Arbitration (PTA) support to coordinate 2.5 GHz RF traffic for co-located ZigBee/Thread and Wi-Fi radios is described (for the EFR32MG only).

contentItemData.label: UG103-07: Fundamentals - Tokens
contentItemData.description: SL Thread: Describes tokens and shows how to use them in EmberZNet PRO, EmberZNet RF4CE, and Silicon Labs Thread applications. It also discusses bindings, the ZigBee PRO application-defined associations between two devices on a network.

contentItemData.label: UG115: ASHv3 Protocol Reference
contentItemData.description: Describes the protocol used by the UART-based ASHv3 to reliably carry commands and responses between a host processor and a network co-processor.

contentItemData.label: UG266: Silicon Labs Gecko Bootloader User's Guide
contentItemData.description: SL Thread: Describes the high-level implementation of the Silicon Labs Gecko Bootloader for EFR32 SoCs and NCPs, and provides information on how to get started using the Gecko Bootloader with Silicon Labs wireless protocol stacks.

contentItemData.label: UG103-06: Fundamentals - Bootloading
contentItemData.description: SL Thread: Introduces bootloading for Silicon Labs networking devices. Discusses the Gecko Bootloader as well as legacy Ember and Bluetooth bootloaders, and describes the file formats used by each.

contentItemData.label: AN760: Using the Ember Standalone Bootloader
contentItemData.description: SL Thread: For EFR32xG12 platforms and newer, see UG266: Silicon Labs Gecko Bootloader User Guide. This describes using the legacy Ember Standalone Bootloader for EM3x and early EFR32 platforms. The Ember Standalone bootloader is a simple, dedicated program to facilitate input of new application/stack firmware via Xmodem upload to a serial interface (SPI or UART) or via a proprietary, IEEE 802.15.4-based, single-hop MAC layer RF protocol.

contentItemData.label: AN710: Bringing Up Custom Devices for the EM35x SoC or NCP Platform
contentItemData.description: SL Thread: Contains a list of Customer Information Block (CIB) tokens and explains how to program/use the CIB, a special non-volatile area of Flash that contains information such as custom EUI64, install code, certificates and other data that can only be programmed through an external interface such as JTAG serial wire.

contentItemData.label: Silicon Labs Thread Framework ZCL over IP README
contentItemData.description: SL Thread: Describes the set of lugins that provide ZCL over IP functionality

contentItemData.label: UG107: ISA3 Utilities Guide
contentItemData.description: SL Thread: Describes how to use the standalone ISA3 utilities supplied with EmberZNet PRO and Silicon Labs Thread software. It also gives a brief overview of the various file types that may be used.

contentItemData.label: UG162: Simplicity Commander Reference Guide
contentItemData.description: SL Thread: Describes how and when to use Simplicity Commander's Command-Line Interface. Only EFR32 is currently supported. EM3xx is not supported at this time.

contentItemData.label: Thread Test App CLI Reference Guide
contentItemData.description: SL Thread: Describes the Command-Line Interface (CLI) available in the thread-test-app, a compilable application used for simple CLI-based Thread testing, and testing with the Thread Group Test Harness.

contentItemData.label: UG103-11: Fundamentals - Thread
contentItemData.description: SL Thread: Includes a brief background on the emergence of Thread, provides a technology overview, and describes some key features of Thread to consider when implementing a Thread solution.

contentItemData.label: UG116: Developing Custom Border Router Applications
contentItemData.description: SL Thread: Provides information on developing custom variants of all or part of the software required for a border router device.

contentItemData.label: AN715: Using the EM35x ADC
contentItemData.description: SL Thread: Describes how to use the EM35x Analog to Digital Converter (ADC), a first-order sigma-delta converter, gives an overview of the internal design, discusses design considerations, and provides example code of fundamental usage.

contentItemData.label: AN912: SPI Host Interfacing Guide for Thread
contentItemData.description: SL Thread: Describes how to set up and test communication between a host and Network Co-Processor (NCP) using the SPI (Serial Peripheral Interface). It assumes that you have a Raspberry Pi, jumper wires (for SPI communication), and a development board. It applies to Silicon Labs Thread stack version 1.0.4 or later.

contentItemData.label: UG104: Testing and Debugging Applications for the Silicon Labs EM35x and Mighty Gecko (EFR32MG) Platforms
contentItemData.description: SL Thread: Describes strategies for testing and debugging applications, including: hardware and application considerations, initial development testing, and lab testing. For additional information about later stages of programming and testing see application notes AN700, Manufacturing Test Guidelines, and AN718, Manufacturing Test Overview.

contentItemData.label: UG110: EM35x Development Kit User Guide
contentItemData.description: SL Thread: Describes the EM35x Development Kit and explains how to set up its hardware and use the Debug Adapter (ISA3). Descriptions of some of the software tools available are provided, along with examples of their use.

contentItemData.label: QSG102: Silicon Labs Thread Border Router Add-On Kit Quick-Start Guide
contentItemData.description: SL Thread: Describes the Silicon Labs Thread Border Router Kit, how to set it up with an existing EM35x Development Kit, and how to demonstrate an example application.

contentItemData.label: QSG113: Getting Started with Silicon Labs Thread
contentItemData.description: SL Thread: Provides basic information on installing your development environment, and configuring, building, and installing applications for the Mighty Gecko family and EM35x using the Silicon Labs Thread stack.

contentItemData.label: UG103-03: Fundamentals - Design Choices
contentItemData.description: SL Thread: Discusses the major decisions that must be made about which wireless protocol you should use, as well as additional decisions to be made if you are designing a ZigBee solution.

contentItemData.label: AN1019: Using the NodeTest Application
contentItemData.description: SL Thread: Describes how to use NodeTest, a pre-built application supplied by Silicon Labs for the purpose of performing RF evaluation, functional testing, and hardware validation. It contains RF test functions pertinent to IEEE 802.15.4-based radio configurations such as those used by the Silicon Labs EmberZNet PRO and Silicon Labs Thread stacks on platforms such as the EM35x, Mighty Gecko, or Flex Gecko families.

contentItemData.label: AN717: Programming Options - For the EM35x Platform
contentItemData.description: SL Thread: Describes the various programming options available to EM35x series customers - the Debug Adapter (ISA3) for the developer environment and the prototype and low-volume production environment, and gang programmers, in-system programmers (ISPs), and in-circuit test (ICT) programming options for the high-volume production environment.

contentItemData.label: Silicon Labs Thread Release Notes
contentItemData.description: SL Thread: Lists compatibility requirements and sources for all software components in the development environment. Discusses the latest changes to the Silicon Labs Thread stack (and associated utilities) including added/deleted/deprecated features/API, and lists bugs that have been fixed since the last release and any pending ones.

contentItemData.label: AN844: Guide to Host/Network Co-Processor Communications Using Silicon Labs Thread and Connect
contentItemData.description: SL Thread: Describes how to set up and test UART communication between a host and Network Co-Processor (NCP) using ASHv3-UART. It assumes that you have a Raspberry Pi, USB cable (for UART communication), and a development board.

contentItemData.label: Thread Test Application GRL Test Harness CLI Reference Guide
contentItemData.description: SL Thread: Describes the Command-Line Interface (CLI) available in the Thread Test Application, an application used for testing in the GRL Thread Test Harness. All of the commands described in this document are found in the Thread Test Harness CLI plugin.

contentItemData.label: AN740: Using the Ember EM358x/EM359x USB
contentItemData.description: SL Thread: Provides key information for using the Ember EM358x USB. The goal of the EM358x USB is to only act as COM port replacement for UART-style functionality.

contentItemData.label: UG103-01: Fundamentals - Wireless Networking
contentItemData.description: SL Thread: Introduces some fundamental concepts of wireless networking. These concepts are referred to in other Fundamentals documents. If you are new to wireless networking, read this document first.

contentItemData.label: AN700: Manufacturing Test Guidelines
contentItemData.description: SL Thread: Details the different options for integrating RF testing and characterization into your standard test flows.

contentItemData.label: AN1010: Building a Customized NCP Application
contentItemData.description: SL Thread: Provides instructions for configuring various aspects of an NCP application image using the Application Builder tool within Simplicity Studio.

contentItemData.label: AN709: Adjacent Channel Rejection Measurements - For 802.15.4 radios
contentItemData.description: SL Thread: Presents the method Silicon Labs uses to measure Adjacent channel rejection (ACR) on its IEEE 802.15.4-2003 compliant ICs, and compares it to other methods. ACR is a measure of how well a reciever performs on its frequency channel when there is an interfering system in the vicinity operating on a nearby channel.

contentItemData.label: UG103-08: Fundamentals - Tools
contentItemData.description: SL Thread: Provides an overview of the toolchain used to develop, build, and deploy EmberZNet and Silicon Labs Thread applications, and discusses some addition tools and utilities.

contentItemData.label: AN718: Manufacturing Test Overview
contentItemData.description: SL Thread: Provides a high-level description of the different options for integrating RF testing and characterization into your standard test flows. It is intended for customers who are moving from the early prototype development stage to the manufacturing production environment and need assistance with manufacturing test.
